meanings.definition: To crush or press into wrinkles or folds
meanings.sent1: She accidentally crumpled the paper while trying to fold it neatly.
meanings.sent2: Please be careful not to crumple your clothes when packing them in the suitcase.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy loves to crumple up any paper he finds lying around.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the books caused the bag to crumple under the pressure.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph had started to crumple at the edges, showing its age.

meanings.sent1: The empty soda can crumpled under his foot as he stepped on it.
meanings.sent2: The cardboard box crumpled under the weight of the heavy books.
meanings.sent3: The tent started to crumple inwards as the wind picked up speed.
meanings.sent4: His dreams of becoming a pilot began to crumple when he failed the test.
meanings.sent5: The sandcastle crumpled into a heap as the waves washed over it.

meanings.definition: A wrinkle or crease in something
meanings.sent1: She smoothed out the crumple in the tablecloth before setting the table.
meanings.sent2: The crumple in his shirt showed that he had slept in it.
meanings.sent3: The crumple in the map made it difficult to read the directions.
meanings.sent4: The crumple in the carpet where the chair had been moved was noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The crumple in the paper made it look like it had been scrunched up and then flattened out again.
